intro: Phyllanthus melvilleorum, commonly known as Melville's phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, green, fleshy leaves and inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
